segments.key_quote: When the personality of Godhead Lord Krishna left this earthly planet in its self-same form, from that very day, Kali, who had already partially appeared, became fully manifest to create inauspicious conditions for those who are endowed with the power of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 36th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining that Kali Yuga fully manifested upon Krishna's departure, bringing inauspicious conditions.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing the 36th and 37th verses of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. The 36th verse first. The meaning of this verse is: When the personality of Godhead Lord Krishna left this earthly planet in its self-same form, from that very day, Kali, who had already partially appeared, became fully manifest to create inauspicious conditions for those who are endowed...

segments.key_quote: Krishna's departure from this world to his personal abode in his self-same form, not change of body.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Krishna's departure was not a change of body like ordinary death, but a return to his eternal abode in his original form, contrasting material and spiritual realities and explaining that Kali's influence is limited to those with a poor fund of knowledge.
segments.transcript: So Krishna's departure from this world to his personal abode in his self-same form, not change of body. This difference has to be noted. In the Bhagavad Gita, Krishna says, "Death means change of body." Now here, Krishna is departing to his personal abode in the self-same form. He never changes his spiritual form. So eternally he is the Lord. But eternally he has his form. Eternally he has everything. He has his energies. He has his paraphernalia. He has his name. He has his qualities. He has his activities. Everything eternal. So this distinction should be understood between material name, material form, material paraphernalia, material activities, material possessions, material manifestation. Everything is temporary. Everything material is temporary. And everything spiritual is permanent, eternal, changeless. As long as Krishna was present, Kali could not manifest its actual characteristic of inauspicious conditions. But when Krishna left this earthly planet, from that very day, Kali manifested, became fully manifest. And the full manifestation means creating inauspicious conditions for those who are endowed with a poor fund of knowledge.

segments.key_quote: The influence of Kali can be enforced only upon those who are not fully developed in God consciousness.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that those fully developed in God consciousness and engaged in pure devotional service are beyond the influence of Kali and the material modes of nature.
segments.transcript: Prabhupada explains in the purport: The influence of Kali can be enforced only upon those who are not fully developed in God consciousness. So Kali, or for that matter even the material modes of nature, cannot act upon those who are fully developed in God consciousness. Krishna says this in the Bhagavad Gita: those who are engaged in pure devotional service in an unfailing manner, they are always on the spiritual platform, Brahma Bhuyaya Kalpate Guna Tita. They are above the three modes, above the influence of the three modes. And above the influence of the three modes also means above the influence of Kali because Kali acts in the material atmosphere through the three gunas.

segments.key_quote: One can neutralize the effects of Kali by keeping oneself fully under the supreme care of the personality of Godhead.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes taking complete shelter of Krishna for protection from Kali, contrasting Krishna's transcendental reality with the illusory nature of the material world.
segments.transcript: Prabhupada says further, one can neutralize the effects of Kali by keeping oneself fully under the supreme care of the personality of Godhead. Actually, Krishna is our only protector, only maintainer, and we should take complete shelter of Krishna through the proper method. Our material method will not work because Krishna is not a material personality. This material personality is a concoction, is a creation of the illusory energy, whereas Krishna's personality is beyond all material manifestations, beyond illusion, is a sent person reality, eternal reality. So take shelter of Krishna who always does give permanent eternal protection to everyone except those who turn away from him and are in the clutches of the illusory energy, except for them.

segments.key_quote: As soon as he left the symptoms of Kali Yuga as were envisioned by Maharaj Yudhishthira prior to Arjuna's arrival from Dwaraka began to manifest.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the age of Kali began after the battle of Kurukshetra, but its influence was suppressed by Krishna's presence, and upon his departure, ill omens appeared, indicating the full manifestation of Kali Yuga.
segments.transcript: That's what Prabhupada is telling here. The age of Kali ensued just after the battle of Kurukshetra, but it could not exert its influence because of the presence of the Lord, because of the presence of Lord Krishna. The Lord, however, left this earthly planet in his own transcendental body, self-same form. That's what is said in this verse, his own transcendental body. And as soon as he left, the symptoms of Kali Yuga as were envisioned by Maharaj Yudhishthira prior to Arjuna's arrival from Dwaraka began to manifest. And Maharaj Yudhishthira rightly conjectured on the departure of the Lord from the earth even before Arjuna could come back with the actual news of the departure of Krishna from Dwaraka. Yudhishthira Maharaj, seeing the ill omens, conjectured that these ill omens are indicating Krishna's departure from this world. As we have already explained, the Lord left our sight just as when the sun sets it is out of our sight. Nothing happens to the sun when it sets, it is just disappeared from our vision, our sight.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Yudhishthira was intelligent enough to understand the influence of the age of Kali characterized by increasing avarice, falsehoods.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 37th verse, explaining that Maharaj Yudhishthira understood the influence of Kali Yuga, characterized by increasing avarice and falsehoods.
segments.transcript: The 37th verse: yudhishthira stat parisarpanam budhaha purecha rashtrecha grihe tathatmani vibhavya lobhan jihma himsa nadi adharma chakram gamanaya paryadhat. The meaning of this verse, 37th verse: Maharaj Yudhishthira was intelligent enough to understand the influence of the age of Kali characterized by increasing avarice. Avarice means greed, falsehoods...

segments.key_quote: The influence of the age of Kali is meant for godless so-called civilized man.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the symptoms of Kali Yuga, including greed, falsehood, and violence, and contrasts godless, uncivilized people with God-conscious, civilized individuals.
segments.transcript: The influence of the age of Kali began manifesting, and from authentic scriptures it is learned that the age of Kali still has to run on for 427,000 years. If I were to put it in the form of lakhs, the total duration of Kali is 4,32,000, out of which 5,000, if you deduct what remains, this balance is 427,000 years. So, the symptoms of the Kali Yuga as mentioned above, namely avarice, greed (avarice means greed), falsehood, diplomacy (diplomacy means duplicitous behavior), cheating, nepotism, violence, and all such things are already involved in the Kali Yuga. And no one can imagine what is going to happen gradually with further increase of the influence of Kali till the day of annihilation. We have already come to know that the influence of the age of Kali is meant for godless so-called civilized man. They call themselves civilized, but they are not civilized. They are godless. So, therefore they are uncivilized. God conscious or godly people are always civilized, are always properly behaving, properly acting, properly situated, have all the good qualities that are to be found in...

segments.key_quote: Those who are under the protection of the Lord have nothing to fear from this horrible age.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that devotees under the Lord's protection have nothing to fear from Kali Yuga, and discusses Yudhishthira's example of retiring from active household life to prepare for going back to Godhead.
segments.transcript: Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha. In fact, demigod means divine nature. So, divine nature means god conscious people, godly character as defined in the scriptures. This is not somebody's concoction. It is a definite description in the 16th chapter of the Bhagavad Gita. The first three verses describe divine qualities, divine characteristics. Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha. Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha. And you can see each one of them is good quality, good qualification, good behavior. Those who are under the protection of the Lord have nothing to fear from this horrible age. Maharaj Yudhishtira was a great devotee of the Lord and there was no necessity of his being afraid of the age of knowledge. Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha. Maheraj Yuddhishtira was a great devotee of the Lord and there was no necessity of his being afraid of the age Kali but he preferred to retire from active household life and prepare himself to go back...

segments.key_quote: Before death comes one must retire from active household life or one must retire from material activities.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of retiring from material activities, including household life, to focus on spiritual realization and prepare for returning to Godhead, using Yudhishthira's example as a lesson.
segments.transcript: Home, back to God. Yudhishthir is a pure devotee, so he doesn't have to actually do any preparation. He is always God conscious. So, but he wants to teach us before death comes, one must retire from active household life, or one must retire from material activities. Even if one is not a householder, even a brahmachari should retire from all material activities and prepare himself to go back home, back to God. So Yudhishthir Mahal is setting the example for us. The Pandavas are eternal companions of the Lord and therefore they are more interested in the company of the Lord than anything else. The eternal companions of the Lord always accompany the Lord in his mission in the material world. That's the meaning of eternal companions in this context. Besides that, being an ideal king, Maharaj Yudhishtira wanted to retire just to set an example for others. As soon as there is some young fellow to look after the family, then after the household affairs, one should at once retire from family life to uplift oneself to spiritual realization. One should not rot in the dark well of household life till one is dragged out by the will of yamaraj. So this is a lesson we should take from Yudhishthira Maharaj's behavior: don't remain in household life till the end of life in the body, before that quit household life.
